definition.name: Skeleton
definition.description: A loading placeholder component that displays an animated pulsing effect. It's commonly used to indicate that content is being loaded, providing a better user experience by showing a visual representation of the content's shape before it arrives.

properties.description: Extends React.HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement> allowing all standard HTML div attributes

className.description: Additional CSS classes to be applied to the skeleton component. These classes will be merged with the default classes using the cn utility.

interactions: Visual feedback through continuous pulse animation
definition.visualLayout: A simple div element that renders as a rounded rectangle with a pulsing animation effect. The background color is set to a semi-transparent version of the primary color.
definition.implementationNotes: The component uses the cn utility function to merge custom className props with default classes. The animate-pulse class provides the loading animation effect, while rounded-md gives rounded corners and bg-primary/10 sets a semi-transparent background color.
